intro: Hemigenia pungens, commonly known as the pungent hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its glandular leaves that emit a strong, often unpleasant odor, especially when crushed. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Hemigenia pungens is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
